thread.title: E-N Game of the Week: Boerne Champion at Kerrville Tivy

author: Ben Baby
title: E-N Game of the Week: Boerne Champion at Kerrville Tivy
text:
Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News Image 1 of / 6 Caption

Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Kerrville Tivy’s Cade Dyal looks for running room between Cedar... Image 5 of 6 Antlers quarterback Cade Dyal lofts a long pass in the first half as Kerrville Tivy plays Gregory Portland at Rutledge Stadium in the third round of the Class 5A Division II playoffs on Nov. 28, 2014.
Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News Antlers quarterback Cade Dyal lofts a long pass in the first half... Image 6 of 6 Antlers running back Hayden Schreckenbach takes the handoff from quarterback Cade Dyal as Kerrville Tivy plays Gregory Portland at Rutledge Stadium in the third round of the Class 5A Division II playoffs on Nov. 28, 2014.
Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News Antlers running back Hayden Schreckenbach takes the handoff from... E-N Game of the Week: Boerne Champion at Kerrville Tivy 1 / 6 Back to Gallery Boerne Champion at Kerrville Tivy
Kickoff: 7:30 p.m. Friday, Antler Stadium, Kerrville
Radio: Web only (TSRNsports.com)
E-N Area rankings/records: No 2. Boerne Champion (3-2 overall, 3-0 District 27-5A); No. 1 Kerrville Tivy (4-0 overall, 2-0 district)
Coaches: Keith Kaiser (21-6 at Boerne Champion, three seasons; 30-28 overall, six seasons); David Jones (29-13 at Kerrville Tivy, four seasons; 67-29 overall, 10 seasons)
Series: Tivy leads 5-2.
Last meeting: Champion won 42-33 in 2014.
Champion breakdown
Setting the scene: The Chargers have won the last two meetings and used the momentum from last year’s victory to take District 27-5A’s top seed in the Class 5A Division II playoffs. Champion was knocked out by Cedar Park in the second round, while Tivy lost to Cedar Park in the fourth round. This year, the Chargers have won three straight after dropping their first two games.
Key to victory: Champion will need to slow down an explosive Tivy offense led by senior quarterback Cade Dyal , who has posted impressive numbers despite playing only one full game. The Antlers have playmakers across the field and Champion’s defense will be tasked with slowing down a team averaging 52 points per game.
Statistical leaders: Passing — Josh Green 87-147-6, 1,197 yards, 10 TDs; rushing — Green 57-584, 7 TDs; receiving — Hayden McMurrey 31-477, 5 TDs; tackles — Trey Moskal, 35; sacks — three tied, 3; interceptions — four tied, 1.
Tivy breakdown
Setting the scene: With the exception of a 39-23 victory at Corpus Christi Calallen, the No. 7 team in the Associated Press Class 5A state poll has cruised. The Antlers have benefitted from the maturation of a 2014 team that was fairly inexperienced before it reached the fourth round. Tivy and Champion are two of the four undefeated teams in 27-5A play.
Key to victory: Tivy coach David Jones said his defense will need to contain Champion quarterback Josh Green, who didn’t play in last season’s game because of a season-ending knee injury. Jones also said stopping Champion’s defensive front from controlling the line of scrimmage will be a key aspect in a game that will have a significant impact on November’s playoff picture.
Statistical leaders: Passing — Cade Dyal 58-83-1, 970 yards, 14 TDs; rushing — Hayden Schreckenbach 26-313, 5 TDs; receiving — Hutch White 16-289, 3 TDs; tackles — Jessy Denais , 35; sacks — Denais, 1.5; interceptions — three tied, 1.
E-N prediction
Tivy 49, Champion 45: With each team’s offense led by a quality quarterback, this has the potential to be a high-scoring game. The Antlers will snap a two-game slide against the Chargers and remain unbeaten this season.
